title: Spelling and Phonics Patterns

vocab.kid_friendly_definition: The relationship between letters and the sounds they make.
A repeated way that letters work together to make sounds.
A part of a word that has one vowel sound.
A letter in a word that you don't say when speaking.
Words that end with the same sound.
A group of words that share an ending pattern like -ight or -ake.
Two vowels together that make one sound, like ai or ea.
Two or more consonants that blend their sounds together, like bl in blue.
Two letters that make one sound, like sh or ch.
A vowel that says its name, like the a in cake.
A vowel with a quick sound, like the a in cat.

teachingNotes: Use word families and common spelling patterns. Practice clapping syllables. Create word walls with pattern examples.

sample.question: How many syllables are in the word 'elephant'?

truefalse.question: Words that rhyme often have the same spelling pattern at the end.
expectedAny: rhyming words often share ending patterns like -ight, -ay, -ack

multiplechoice.question: Which word follows the same pattern as 'night'?
expectedAny: light has the same -ight pattern as night

fillintheblank.question: In the word 'knee,' the letter 'k' is _____ because you don't say it.

shortanswer.question: What are some strategies for spelling words you don't know?
expectedAny: try a vowel team like ai or ea
ask for help and then learn the pattern
